Index.Title: Would you like to help rescue a dragon, too?
Index.Description:
Currently, there has been a rapid increase in the number of baby dragons who have lost their parents due to the outbreak of a strange disease, and it has become a serious issue worldwide.

Therefore, we, the Dragon Disease Protection Association (DDPA), have launched a new website on Earth and are recruiting volunteers who can take care of these baby dragons for free through the net browser.

We sincerely look forward to your applications and participation.

IndexDoc1.Title: What's "Another World VolunterNet"?
IndexDoc1.Description:
Our planet is located 300 million light years away from yours. The planetary environment is similar to Earth, and many creatures exist here, including humans, dragonborn, and beastfolk.

Initially, communicating across such a vast distance would have been impossible, but thanks to artifacts excavated from ancient ruins left on our planet, communication utilizing quantum technology has become possible.

With this groundbreaking communication system, we can reach your side of the network "World Wide Web" through this website.

IndexDoc2.Title: Motivation for this site hosting
IndexDoc2.Description:
Currently, in our world, a disease known as the "Dragon Death Disease" is spreading, causing catastrophic damage. This disease has an extremely high fatality rate, and the modes of transmission are still unknown.

While it is now clear that the disease only affects dragonborns since its emergence, prejudice and discrimination against them have spread. The number of baby dragonborns becoming orphans or abandoned due to the disease continues to rise.
In response, the Dragon Disease Protection Association has partnered with Poiltop to begin efforts to protect and raise the orphaned dragonlings.

However, Poiltop is not financially wealthy and has limited volunteer resources.
Therefore, we have decided to search and recruit volunteers from the entire universe to assist in these dragonlings' emotional care and upbringing.
We have set up access points on three planets, including one on Earth.

Dragonlings need your help.
We need your help.

Please lend us your strength.

IndexDoc3.Title: About Poiltop
IndexDoc3.Description1:
Poiltop is a small port town with a population of around 20,000.
Apart from fishing, there are no notable industries, but what makes it unique is the active interracial communication. Humans, Dragonborn, and Beastfolks live in harmony together here, and it is affectionately called the "city where humans and dragonborn walk together."

In addition, there are many ancient ruins around Poiltop. Artifacts excavated from those ruins created the Quantum Network Systems (QNS) that made communication across the universe possible.

We established a Protection and Support for Diseased Dragons based on these.
IndexDoc3.Description2:
Words from the caretaker, Mr. Niel

"Uh, well...w-what should I say? I'm not good at this kind of stuff..."

"Ah...The dragonlings I care for have been through a lot, but they're all healthy... They even caused me trouble yesterday with their mischief...They eat well...Huh? No more space left!?"

"A...anyway, we're looking forward to you joining. There's no need to be too formal; it's a volunteer job. I want you to become friends with me and the dragonlings. There might be some rough times, but we'll all get along together, you, me, and the dragonlings!"

Register.Description:
Once submitted, the registration form will be transferred via the quantum network.
We will search for the dragon that best matches the information you provided.

Ovewrite.Confirm: There is existing data on this device, continue anyway?

Hint.DontForgetPassword: The password will be required in the future. Choose one that is easy to remember.

Menu.Retire: Release the dragonling back to the wild

Retire.Title: Department of the Ruin Management
Retire.Warning1:
Here, we handle the procedures for those who are too busy or find it burdensome to raise dragonlings.

Please sign here if you wish to forfeit your rights as a foster parent.

The dragonling will return to nature, where it will live its short life.
Retire.Warning2: The dragonling that leaves your care will never return.

Map.GoToConfirm: It's will cost {{turn}} turn(s) to move, proceed?
Map.Hint:
To return to the training screen, click on the "Poiltop" on the map.

In the cave, the dragonling's stamina decreases with each step, so please finde the exit before stamina runs out.

Also, you may find "treasure chests" during your adventure, and the discoverer is allowed to claim ownership by the government.

Feel free to explore as much as you like.

Home.Title: Poiltop Town
Home.Description: Return to the town and resume training.
